text: so what we do in our lab is we make
organic solar cells and so there's a lot
of advantages of having an organic solar
cell the first is that the materials are
much cheaper than traditional solar
cells that that are out on the market
one of the drawbacks currently is the
efficiencies are low and they're they're
hard to you know make them cheap enough
that people want to buy them and so part
of what we're trying to do is discover
and investigate how we can kind of you
know get that out there so what we do is
we put a polymer which is conductive in
a semi conducting polymer onto a glass
slide and then on to that we deposit
aluminum and so one of the things that
we have in our lab here is an evaporator
which thermally evaporates aluminum on
to that cell so this is a bell jar
evaporator and inside that bell jar
evaporator you have an aluminum slug it
heats up goes to a liquid and then from
the evaporation coats the surface of
things and then you can pull it right
out of the evaporator and test it right
inside of this glove box so one of the
problems with these plastics is that
when they're out in the environment they
degrade in air so you need them to
either encapsulate which is seal them so
that the air can't get at it or do your
testing in an environment that doesn't
have oxygen and so this glove box is
back filled with nitrogen and
essentially eliminating all of the
oxygen and so we have a liquid nitrogen
tank outside that pipes in nitrogen gas
and fills this up and so we can actually
from right inside of this system just
test our solar cells and so in here you
can record the temperature of the cells
at and you actually bias it with a
voltage and then measure the current
that comes out this essentially allows
you to figure out what the efficiencies
you have of your cell how much actual
power you're getting out of your cell
and so for this example we have this IV
curve which is essentially a trace of
how efficient the cell is and then you
can use this to essentially say okay
this cell is around four percent
efficient and this whole system allows
us to to get that information thank you
my name is Brett garlic from the
University of Delaware and I work for
the Mackey group
